intro: Calochlaena villosa, commonly known as the silky calochlaena, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its softly hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. This species is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
